author: Jessica Van Sack
title: This is the droid you’re looking for, ‘Star Wars’ fans
text:
This is the droid you’re looking for, ‘Star Wars’ fans Jessica Van Sack Monday, October 12, 2015 Sphero BB-8 App-Enabled Droid comments Tweet Sphero BB-8 App-Enabled Droid ($149.99, various retailers)
“Star Wars” merchandise is everywhere, but this one seems exceptionally cool. This new robotic device is a replica of the movie’s new robotic sidekick. If you’re familiar with Sphero, you’ll notice its similarities to the company’s robotic ball, but with the tiny head of BB-8 on top.
The good: Paired with an app running on your Apple or Android device, this little guy responds to voice commands (iOS only) and can roll around and balance by itself. It charges with a simple included base that doubles as a cute stand. Sit back and laugh as the BB-8 explores your home, runs into an object and identifies it as an enemy. The BB-8 is tons of fun, and likely to fly off shelves this holiday season.
The bad: It can’t detect elevation and the price is a bit much.
The bottom line: Move over R2-D2. The force is strong with this new robot.
